alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:27AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Crittenden, western DeSoto and southwestern Shelby Counties through 1100 AM CDT... At 1026 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pinckney, or 10 miles southwest of T O Fuller State Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Horn Lake, Hernando, Memphis, Walls, Horseshoe Lake, Pinckney, Lake Cormorant, Lynchburg, Eudora, Whitehaven, Newport, Frees Corners, Nesbit, Glover, Jago, Robinson Gin, Alden, Twin Lakes and West Days. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
